posts.post_content: [Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood) is amazing: a 1-sided [Prey Upon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prey Upon) that can target players. What a great way to break through a combat stalemate. And the fact that [Flesh](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flesh) can target any graveyard is a nice bonus to the scavenge mechanic.
posts.html:
Blood is amazing: a 1-sided Prey Upon that can target players. What a great way to break through a combat stalemate. And the fact that Flesh can target any graveyard is a nice bonus to the scavenge mechanic.

posts.post_content:
Unfortunate that the biggest creatures in Magic never hit the graveyard to get exiled by this. [Worldspine Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldspine Wurm), [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn), [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), etc...  
(Except [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction). Shhh! Don't tell anyone!)

posts.post_content:
The flesh part is somewhat random and overcosted in my opinion. The blood part however is very nice.  
  
The problem of the flesh part is following:  
a) it can only exile creatures, whereas there exist also quite a number of other cards that are dangerous while in a graveyard  
b) sorcery speed, you can't exile a creature in response to a reanimation spell to interrupt combos  
c) mana cost. five mana in two colors is a huge amount. Compare it to [cremate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cremate). It's a cantrip, instant speed, can exile any card and costs only one mana.  
d) if you have no creature to put the counters on, or it has shroud or protection from green or black or whatever, then you are forced to put the +1/+1 counters on a creature your opponent controls  
e) ideally you wouldn't want only any creature to put the counters on, but one that can actually make good use of the counters, such as, for example, a triskelion  
f) unless you exile your own stuff, the card is quite random. Your opponent might not have ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
The flesh part is somewhat random and overcosted in my opinion. The blood part however is very nice.

The problem of the flesh part is following:
a) it can only exile creatures, whereas there exist also quite a number of other cards that are dangerous while in a graveyard
b) sorcery speed, you can't exile a creature in response to a reanimation spell to interrupt combos
c) mana cost. five mana in two colors is a huge amount. Compare it to cremate. It's a cantrip, instant speed, can exile any card and costs only one mana.
d) if you have no creature to put the counters on, or it has shroud or protection from green or black or whatever, then you are forced to put the +1/+1 counters on a creature your opponent controls
e) ideally you wouldn't want only any creature to put the counters on, but one that can actually make good use of the counters, such as, for example, a triskelion
f) unless you exile your own stuff, the card is quite random. Your opponent might not have ... (see all)
